sources.title: Salems Lot (1979)
sources.description: Salem's Lot is a 1979 American television miniseries directed by Tobe Hooper, based on Stephen King's novel of the same name. It is notable for being one of the first adaptations of a King's work and for its chilling portrayal of vampire horror. The story revolves around Ben Mears, a writer who returns to the town of Jerusalem's Lot (commonly referred to as Salemâ€™s Lot) in Maine, only to discover that its residents are being turned into vampires by a sinister newcomer, Kurt Barlow. As Ben becomes aware of the supernatural threat, he teams up with local townsfolk to confront the growing vampire menace.
